comment._content: From the top of the Harbour Trust Building.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/berniep/]  [http://www.flickr.com/photos/agrippinamaior/] There was a bit of comment about the railway tunnel here -
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4930536525/] It seems the tunnel was built in the 1920s (or 1930s?) and used as a shelter in WW2.

Interesting to spot the differences on all these photos.  Earlier ? -
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/6924398449/]

Earliest ? -
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/4903285467/]

comment.author: 8793648@N06
comment._content: Work stated on the city railway loop connection in 1936 and stopped during WW2. So this is definitely post-1936.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32162360@N00][http://www.flickr.com/photos/berniep/][http://www.flickr.com/photos/agrippinamaior/ ] The line to St James railway Station opened on 20 December 1926. The tunnel and tunnel portal were built and completed at the same time. All part of the Bradfield plan.

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] ah awesome! yes the bottom one is earlier. It has the original First & Last Hotel in it (in the spot where I put the note in this page's image) Originally it was called Clarke's and was built in about 1851, then renamed the Belmore in c1869, the original building was demolished c1910 the new one was up by 1911. So the bottom photo's pretty early :D
